chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq ", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines: Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts. Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'. Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary. Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided. Example 1: Hypotheses: n, m: nat IHn: m + n = n + m Goal: m + S n = S n + m Proof: ```coq simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Example 2: Hypotheses: Goal: forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m ```coq intros n m. induction n. - simpl. auto. - simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto. Qed.``` Solve This Proof State: Hypotheses: X: Type P: X -> Prop mm: list X ll: list X Goal: Forall P (ll ++ mm) <-> Forall P ll /\ Forall P mm Premises: Forall : forall A : Type, (A -> Prop) -> list A -> Prop Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename Forall_app : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ l2) < -> Forall P l1 /\ Forall P l2 Forall2_Forall : forall (X : Type) (R : X -> X -> Prop) (ll : list X), Forall2 R ll ll < -> Forall (fun x : X => R x x) ll list_first_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall (a : X) (ll : list X), P a -> In a ll -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}} Forall_and_inv : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l -> Forall P l /\ Forall Q l Forall_and : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall Q l -> Forall (fun x : A => P x /\ Q x) l list_choose_dec : forall (X : Type) (P : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall ll : list X, {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ P x /\ (forall y : X, In y l -> ~ P y)}}} + {forall x : X, In x ll -> ~ P x} prefix_rect : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> list X -> Type), (forall ll : list X, P nil ll) -> (forall (x : X) (l ll : list X), l

P l ll -> P (x :: l) (x :: ll)) -> forall l ll : list X, l

P l ll Forall_rev : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l -> Forall P (rev l) Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l) incl_Forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l1 l2 : list A), incl l2 l1 -> Forall P l1 -> Forall P l2 Forall_inv_tail : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> Forall P l Forall_forall : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall x : A, In x l -> P x) Forall_impl : forall (A : Type) (P Q : A -> Prop), (forall a : A, P a -> Q a) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> Forall Q l Exists_Forall_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), (forall x : A, P x \/ ~ P x) -> Exists (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Forall P l Forall_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> Prop), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l Forall_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : list A -> SProp), P0 nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> P0 l -> P0 (x :: l)) -> forall l : list A, Forall P l -> P0 l Forall_Exists_neg : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall (fun x : A => ~ P x) l < -> ~ Exists P l Forall_elt : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l1 l2 : list A), Forall P (l1 ++ a :: l2) -> P a Forall_nth : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (l : list A), Forall P l < -> (forall (i : nat) (d : A), i < length l -> P (nth i l d)) list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}} Forall_inv : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (a : A) (l : list A), Forall P (a :: l) -> P a map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}} list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}} Forall_dec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, {P x} + {~ P x}) -> forall l : list A, {Forall P l} + {~ Forall P l} Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), Forall P nil

```coq
split.
- intros H. split.
  * intro H1. apply Forall_app. auto.
  * intro H1. apply Forall_app. auto.
- intros [H1 H2]. apply Forall_app. auto.
Qed.
